page.title: 08THE SCHOOL IN TYDD ST.GILES.
page.content: The first school ever held in this village was in the church.The school master for all the boys was Samuel Clarke.The girls were taught by Mrs.Parker. The old school was built in 1860.Canon John Scott,the rector,collected Â£150 for the school to be built.The national society made a grant of Â£70.The school was designed by Gilbert Scott,the rector's brother.Mr. and Mrs. Burling,who were the first teachers in the school,were teaching over 100 pupils.It was desinged so it had a bell at the top. The new school was opened on Monday 18th of March 1963.It was opened by Christopher Chataway, an M.P.The biggest number of children in the school has been 87.The number at the present is about 40 children.
